content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Use-case: Smelting basic materials.
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace (position: 0.0, 0.0)
– Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5)

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (-16.0, -51.0)
Use-case: Extraction and preliminary processing of iron ore.
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill (position: -16.0, -51.0) [status: NO_FUEL]
– Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -49.5) [status: NO_FUEL]
– Transport Belt (implied at approximately -15.5, -49.5)
– Iron Chest (position: -13.5, -49.5)
– Intermediate Transport Belt (implied at approximately -15.5, -47.5)
– Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -47.5) [status: WAITING_FOR_SOURCE_ITEMS]
– Iron Chest (position: -13.5, -47.5)

### Copper Furnace at position (-27.0, -60.0)
Use-case: Processing copper ore.
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace (position: -27.0, -60.0) [warnings: no ingredients to smelt]

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Use-case: Supporting research through integrated power and fluid supply.
Consists of:
– Lab (position: 0.5, 2.5) [electrical_id: 36257]
– Offshore Pump (position: -7.5, 25.5)
– Boiler (position: 2.0, 17.5) [warnings: no input liquid, no fluid present in connections]
– Steam Engine (position: 5.5, 5.5) [warnings: not connected to power network, no input liquid]

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Use-case: Manufacturing of pipes.
Consists of:
– Assembling Machine (position: 3.5, 0.5) [warnings: not receiving electricity; missing iron-plate]
– Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5)
– Electricity network via Small Electric Poles connected through Electricity Group (id: 36257) at positions:
  • (3.5, -1.5)
  • (3.5, -2.5)
  • (6.5, 0.5)
  • (3.5, 2.5)
  • (4.5, 3.5)
  • (6.5, 3.5)

### Fluid Pipelines (Pipe Groups)
Use-case: Interconnecting fluid transport components.
Consists of:
– PipeGroup at position (8.5, 5.5) with fluid_system == 117628  
  • Pipe (position: 8.5, 5.5)
  • Pipe (position: 8.5, 6.5)
– PipeGroup at position (10.5, 4.5) with fluid_system == 117629  
  • Pipe (position: 10.5, 4.5)
  • Pipe (position: 11.5, 4.5)
  • Pipe (position: 12.5, 4.5) with additional segments at (7.5, 14.5), (7.5, 15.5), (8.5, 14.5)
– PipeGroup at position (-9.5, 9.5) with fluid_system == 117632, fluid: water  
  • Pipe (position: -9.5, 9.5)
  • Pipe (position: -8.5, 9.5)
  • Pipe (position: -8.5, 8.5) with segments extending to (-1.5, 24.5), (-0.5, 24.5), (0.5, 24.5)
– PipeGroup at position (2.5, 9.5) with fluid_system == 117635  
  • Pipe (position: 2.5, 9.5)
  • Pipe (position: 3.5, 9.5)
  • Pipe (position: 3.5, 10.5)
  • Pipe (position: 3.5, 11.5)
  • Pipe (position: 2.5, 10.5)
– PipeGroup at position (10.5, 9.5) with fluid_system == 117636  
  • Pipe (position: 10.5, 9.5)
  • Pipe (position: 10.5, 8.5)
  • Pipe (position: 9.5, 15.5) with segments at (9.5, 16.5), (6.5, 18.5), (7.5, 18.5)
– PipeGroup at position (1.5, 11.5) with fluid_system == 117641  
  • Pipe (position: 1.5, 11.5)
  • Pipe (position: 1.5, 13.5)
  • Pipe (position: 0.5, 13.5) with additional segments at (5.5, 14.5), (4.5, 14.5), (4.5, 15.5)
– PipeGroup at position (-1.5, 17.5) with fluid_system == 117652  
  • Pipe (position: -1.5, 17.5)
– PipeGroup at position (6.5, 16.5) with fluid_system == 117655  
  • Pipe (position: 6.5, 16.5)
– PipeGroup at position (-1.5, 21.5) with fluid_system == 117656  
  • Pipe (position: -1.5, 21.5)

### Integrated Components
Use-case: Facilitate power distribution and link mined resources.
Consists of:
– Electricity Group connecting Small Electric Poles via ElectricityGroup (id: 36257) at positions:
  • (3.5, -1.5)
  • (3.5, -2.5)
  • (6.5, 0.5)
  • (3.5, 2.5)
  • (4.5, 3.5)
  • (6.5, 3.5)
– Belt connections linking components of the Iron Ore Mining Setup:
  • Belt at (approximately -15.5, -49.5) [direction: DOWN]
  • Belt at (approximately -15.5, -47.5) [direction: UP]

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
• PipeGroup Connection Failures  
  – Multiple connection attempts near (-1.5, 17.5) using candidate PipeGroups with fluid_system identifiers have failed. Previously attempted identifiers include: 110836, 110978, 111120, 111262, 111404, 111546, 111688, 111830, 111972, 112114, 112256, 112398, 112540, 112682, 112824, 112966, 113108, 113250, 113392, 113534, 113676, 113818, 113960, 114102, 114244, 114386, 114528, 114670, 114812, 114954, 115096, 115238; then new attempts: 115380, 115522, 115664, 115806, 115948, 116090, 116232, 116374; and most recently: 116516, 116658, 116800, 116942, 117084, 117226, 117368, 117510.  
   Tip: Confirm candidate existence, verify spatial alignment, and update connection attempts to use the current fluid_system identifier (for example, 117652 at (-1.5, 17.5)).
• Assembling Machine Resource and Power Issues  
  – The assembling machine at (3.5, 0.5) is not receiving electricity and is missing a required iron-plate.  
   Tip: Secure stable power connections and ensure the necessary resource supply.
• Burner Mining Drill Fuel Shortage  
  – The burner mining drill at (-16.0, -51.0) is out of fuel.  
   Tip: Refill fuel prior to extraction operations.
• Power Generation and Fluid Supply Connection Issues  
  – The boiler at (2.0, 17.5) and the steam engine at (5.5, 5.5) lack proper fluid connections.  
   Tip: Validate fluid inputs and ensure proper connection points.
• Insufficient Inventory for Fluid Connections  
  – Low inventory levels for pipes and connection components are hampering fluid setup operations.  
   Tip: Verify and replenish inventory before attempting further connections.

────────────────────────
NAMESPACE
• get_entity(entity: Any, position: Any) -> Any  
  – Retrieves an entity of the specified type at the given position.
   • Success: Returns the located entity.
   • Failure: Raises an exception if the entity is not found.
• pipe_entity(pipe: entities.Pipe) -> Any  
  – Processes a pipe entity during pipeline connection routines.
• rotate_entity(entity: Any, direction: Any) -> Any  
  – Rotates the given entity to the specified direction for proper alignment.
• insert_item(resource: Any, target: Any, quantity: int) -> Any  
  – Inserts a specified quantity of a resource into the target inventory.
• get_connection_amount(virtual_candidate: Any, boiler_connection: Any, pipe_proto: Prototype.Pipe) -> int  
  – Calculates the number of pipe segments required to establish a fluid connection; raises an exception if conditions are not met.

Important Variables:
• pump_working (OffshorePump) – Holds the working offshore pump entity at position (-7.5, 25.5).
• boiler_original (Boiler) – Represents the boiler entity at position (2.0, 17.5).
• candidate_intermediate_offpump (Position) – Candidate connection point for linking the Offshore Pump.
• candidate_intermediate_boiler (Position) – Candidate connection point for linking the Boiler.
• boiler_connection_point (Position) – Intended connection point for the boiler’s water supply.
• steam_engine_connection_point (Position) – Intended connection point for the Steam Engine’s steam input.
• pipe_count (int) – Tracks the current number of available pipes.
• distance (float) – Calculated distance for pipeline segments.
• final_inventory (Inventory) – Snapshot of inventory item counts after recent operations.
• virtual_candidate (Position) – Virtual candidate connection point used for manual pipe placement.
